intro: Carduncellus duvauxii, commonly known as the Duvaux's carduncellus, is a rare and specialized plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, often hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, adapting to harsh climatic conditions with its succulent leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
